title: Is this really purely coincidence? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Note that the ratio of the longest and shortest lengths of objects in our universe is…” Gonna have to see evidence that the longest item in the universe has been measured. If they haven’t(and I doubt they have), how do I know they didn’t pick the longest objects that would come out to 10 to the 41st power ratio to all the shortest objects in the universe(also impossible to measure).

this is simply not true. Let’s see time. The shortest meaningful time interval is the Planck time, which is 5.4 × 10^ -44 s. The longest time should be the age of the universe, which is approximately 14 billion years, or ~ 4.4 × 10^17 s. Obviously, the ratio of the two is very far from 10^41. — you could have rotated that image, my neck hurts :)
